author: la r√©daction avec AFP
title: Venezuela. Nicol√°s Maduro envoie des milliers de soldats √† la fronti√®re avec le Guyana
text: Venezuela Nicol√°s Maduro envoie des milliers de soldats √† la fronti√®re avec le Guyana Cette annonce intervient en pleine crise sur l‚ÄôEssequibo, territoire riche en p√©trole revendiqu√© par le Venezuela, apr√®s le d√©ploiement d‚Äôun navire de patrouille militaire par le Royaume-Uni en soutien au Guyana. La tension monte encore entre le Venezuela et le Guyana. Le pr√©sident v√©n√©zu√©lien a lanc√© ce jeudi des exercices militaires avec 5 600 soldats dans la zone frontali√®re du Guyana en ¬´ r√©ponse √† la provocation ¬ª du Royaume-Uni, qui a envoy√© un navire de guerre au Guyana en pleine crise sur l'Essequibo. Un navire pour lutter contre le trafic de drogue ¬´ J'ai ordonn√© l'activation d'une action conjointe de toutes les Forces Arm√©es nationales bolivariennes (v√©n√©zu√©liennes) dans les Cara√Øbes orientales, sur la c√¥te atlantique, une action conjointe de nature d√©fensive, en r√©ponse √† la provocation et √† la menace du Royaume-Uni contre la paix et la souverainet√© de notre pays ¬ª, a d√©clar√© le pr√©sident Nicol√°s Maduro, ce jeudi. Le HMS Trent a √©t√© envoy√© d√©but d√©cembre dans les Cara√Øbes pour lutter contre les trafics de drogue. Il arrivera au Guyana vendredi et doit participer √† des exercices militaires dans les eaux guyaniennes pendant ¬´ moins d'une semaine ¬ª. Il n'est pas pr√©vu qu'il accoste √† Georgetown, a soulign√© une source des Affaires √©trang√®res guyanien. Dans un communiqu√©, le gouvernement v√©n√©zu√©lien avait ¬´ rejet√© cat√©goriquement l'arriv√©e du navire (...) ce qui constitue un acte de provocation hostile ¬ª. ¬´ aucun plan ¬ª pour attaquer le Venezuela Contrairement √† ce dont l'accuse le pr√©sident v√©n√©zu√©lien Nicolas Maduro, le vice-pr√©sident du Guyana, Bharrat Jagdeo, a assur√© n'avoir ¬´ aucun plan pour prendre des mesures offensives contre le Venezuela (...) Nous n'avons pas l'intention d'envahir le Venezuela ¬ª. Il a pr√©cis√© que l'arriv√©e d'un patrouilleur britannique dans les eaux du Guyana entrait dans le cadre ¬´ d'exercices de routine planifi√©s depuis longtemps ¬ª. L'Essequibo, territoire disput√© La tension √©tait mont√©e apr√®s le lancement en septembre d'appels d'offres p√©troliers par le Guyana, puis le r√©f√©rendum organis√© en r√©action le 3 d√©cembre au Venezuela sur un rattachement de l'Essequibo, territoire de 160 000 km2 riche en p√©trole et ressources naturelles, administr√© par Georgetown et revendiqu√© par le Venezuela. Quelque 125 000 personnes, soit un cinqui√®me de la population du Guyana, vivent dans l'Essequibo, qui couvre les deux tiers de la superficie du pays. Le Venezuela soutient que le fleuve Essequibo doit √™tre la fronti√®re naturelle, comme en 1777 √† l'√©poque de l'empire espagnol. Le Guyana argue que la fronti√®re, datant de l'√©poque coloniale anglaise, a √©t√© ent√©rin√©e en 1899 par une cour d'arbitrage √† Paris.

author: France 2
title: Fraude : quand les cartes Pok√©mon font l‚Äôobjet d'un trafic
text:
Dans les mains des enfants, ce sont de simples cartes √† √©changer, qui ne co√ªtent que quelques euros. L‚Äôengouement pour les Pok√©mon, des cr√©atures imaginaires venues du Japon, est devenu plan√©taire. Les cartes se vendent 6 euros les dix, chez les buralistes notamment. Certaines boutiques vendent des imitations, √† 4,90 euros le paquet. " C‚Äôest plus rentable que les vraies ", estime le vendeur. Les contrefa√ßons se trouvent aussi sur Internet. De quoi inspirer des revendeurs malhonn√™tes, qui trompent ensuite les collectionneurs .
Des arnaques en ligne Passionn√© depuis 20 ans, un homme en a fait les frais. Avec ses jumeaux, il cumule plus de 10 000 cartes, soit une fortune de plusieurs dizaines de milliers d‚Äôeuros. Il y a quatre mois, il a achet√© sur un site de revente deux cartes rarissimes : 250 euros. Une fois re√ßues et expertis√©es, elles se sont r√©v√©l√©es fausses. " J‚Äôai essay√© de recontacter le vendeur, mais il a coup√© son compte ", raconte-t-il. Pour s‚Äôassurer qu‚Äôune carte est r√©elle, il faut se tourner vers des experts authentificateurs, sp√©cialistes des cartes. Selon eux, c‚Äôest surtout le dos de la carte qui fait foi.

author: San Marino Rtv
title: ‚ÄúCoraggio, altruismo, spirito di gruppo‚Äù: Maxime Mbanda e Marco Bezzecchi raccontano a pi√π di 200 studenti come lo sport sia palestra di vita
text:
Un incontro intenso e partecipato quello che ha visto questa mattina pi√π di duecento studenti riminesi confrontarsi sui temi della ‚Äúmemoria‚Äù e dei ‚ÄúGiusti tra le nazioni‚Äù insieme a due testimoni d‚Äôeccezione, il campione di rugby,Maxime Mbanda e il pilota di motociclismo Marco Bezzecchi. Al Teatro degli Atti i due grandi campioni hanno raccontato la loro esperienza e risposto alle tante domande degli studenti, provenienti dalla secondaria di primo grado "Aurelio Bertola", la Media Statale "E. Fermi‚Äù. E le scuole superiori: Ragioneria "Istituto tecnico economico statale Roberto Valturio" e l'Alberghiero "IPSEOA Sigismondo Pandolfo Malatesta". ‚ÄúCoraggio, altruismo, spirito di squadra. Il confronto di oggi - ha spiegato nel suo saluto istituzionale Chiara Bellini, vicesindaca con delega alle politiche educative del Comune di Rimini ‚Äì √® un seme di cui raccoglierete i frutti in futuro. Spesso, da momenti solo apparentemente pi√π informali come questi, prendono il via lezioni che ci rimangono dentro per sempre. Il coraggio di questi sportivi ci avvicina a quello, in altri e pi√π drammatici periodi storici, che ha animato non solo i giusti, ma anche i tanti uomini, come i nostri nonni o bisnonni, che hanno combattuto per la libert√† e la giustizia. Quella di oggi √® una tappa che fa parte di un progetto pi√π ampio che coinvolge le scuole e la comunit√† riminese‚Äù. Presente anche l‚Äôassessora alle politiche per i giovani, Francesca Mattei. In particolare, il progetto educativo sui "Giusti" quest'anno verte sul tema dello sport e degli sportivi come esempio di solidariet√†, coraggio e eroismo. In quest'ottica √® inserito l'incontro con i due grandi campioni, Maxime Mbanda, rugbysta, e Marco Bezzecchi, campione riminese di motociclismo. Entrambe figure di spessore, sia nella carriera che nella loro vita, che quella mattina dialogheranno con i ragazzi sui temi della responsabilit√† individuale, del fairplay e dell'impegno a favore dei pi√π deboli. Un'iniziativa che ha lo scopo di unire l'insegnamento storico con storie contemporanee ed esplorare come lo sport possa trasmettere modelli positivi che possano sensibilizzare le giovani generazioni. Il progetto √® curato da Laura Fontana, Responsabile dell'Attivit√† Educazione alla Memoria e Daniele Susini, coordinatore del progetto sui Giusti. L'incontro √® stato organizzato in collaborazione con l'Istituto per la storia della Resistenza e dell'Et√† contemporanea della provincia di Rimini e con l'Associazione Nazionale Vittime Civili di Guerra Onlus ‚Äì Sezione Prov.le Rimini. Un'iniziativa che rientra nel cartellone delle attivit√† di Educazione alla Memoria del Comune di Rimini, che per l'ottavo anno consecutivo vuole valorizzare la memoria e la conoscenza della figura dei "Giusti tra le Nazioni". Il progetto infatti √® iniziato il 12 gennaio scorso e ha visto i ragazzi coinvolti gi√† in otto incontri, tra gennaio e febbraio, con focus sullo sport. Sport, inteso come possibilit√† di competizione che permette di mettere alla prova i propri limiti, ma allo stesso tempo rappresenta un importante strumento di educazione al rispetto dell'altro e delle regole condivise, alla correttezza e onest√† e al superamento della sconfitta.
cs Comune di Rimini

author: Eliana Silver
title: Train driver who sparked 56-day strike after dismissal had fallen ASLEEP at controls
text:
The union's general secretary had suggested the driver was dismissed for reporting a "safety concern"
Don't Miss
Most Read
Trending on GB News
It has been revealed that a train driver, whose dismissal sparked a 56-day trade union strike, fell asleep at the controls and failed to report the incident.
The Aslef union organised the eight-week strike at Hull Trains from March 31 after one of its members was fired.
Mick Whelan, the union's general secretary, criticised Hull Trains for its "failure to act responsibly" and suggested the driver was dismissed for reporting a "safety concern."
However, a letter obtained by The Telegraph showed that the unnamed driver had experienced "fatigue matters" while operating Hull Trains' 125mph services on multiple occasions.
Mick Whelan, the union's general secretary, criticised Hull Trains for its 'failure to act responsibly' and suggested the driver was dismissed for reporting a 'safety concern'
PA
Aslef is calling for the driver's full reinstatement, but Hull Trains management believes he presents an unacceptable safety risk to passengers.
Managing Director Martijn Gilbert stated that the discovery of the fatigue incidents posed ‚Äúa safety risk that we could not ignore.‚Äù
A source close to the case revealed that the driver had admitted to falling asleep at the controls, but only mentioned it in passing some time later.
Aslef organiser Nigel Roebuck previously noted that the driver had worked ‚Äúfor more than 20 years with a completely clean safety record‚Äù before being dismissed.
MORE LIKE THIS:
However, in a letter sent to Roebuck and Whelan, Gilbert said the man had been supported through several ‚Äúprevious similar issues‚Äù.
The letter said: ‚ÄúThe disclosures made by this driver, especially against a backdrop of previous similar issues where full support and feedback was given, presented us with a safety risk that we could not ignore.‚Äù
It added that due to previous incidents, ‚Äúwe have reached a point where we cannot be confident that they can be trusted to properly report safety matters in a safe and appropriate way‚Äù.
Automatic safety systems, including the "dead man's handle," would have stopped the train if it had passed a red stop signal.
Hull Trains Managing Director Martijn Gilbert stated that the discovery of the fatigue incidents posed 'a safety risk that we could not ignore'
PAThe handle is engaged by the driver whenever the train is in motion, and if released, the emergency brakes are activated.
However, if the train had been diverted to a different track with a lower speed limit while the driver was asleep, it could have derailed.
While Aslef initiated the 56-day strike after the driver‚Äôs dismissal, not all members have participated.
Only about 20 per cent of services have been cancelled due to the strike, indicating that not all union members view the action as warranted.
A spokesman for Hull Trains said: ‚ÄúHull Trains follows highly regulated industry standard agreements and procedures for safety.
"We have stringent safety reporting processes and provide extensive ongoing training and health and wellbeing support for our colleagues, which has secured industry recognition.‚Äù
‚ÄúThe safety concern claimed in the response by Aslef is in direct relation to the individual concerned, but it would be inappropriate to comment further on a specific case.‚Äù

author: Agence France-Presse
title: Renewable electricity to outstrip coal next year: IEA
text:
INQUIRER.net stock images
Paris, France ‚Äî The amount of electricity produced from renewable sources worldwide is set to surpass output from coal-fired plants for the first time in 2025, the International Energy Agency said Friday.
The forecast comes as electricity demand is set to rise four percent this year and next, up from 2.5 percent in 2023.
ADVERTISEMENT That would be the highest annual growth since 2007, excepting spikes seen after the global financial crisis that began that year and during the Covid-19 recovery, the Paris-based agency said.
FEATURED STORIES BUSINESS Cebu Pacific, global airlines hit by Microsoft outage BUSINESS BIZ BUZZ: Why St. Luke‚Äôs dropped Davao BUSINESS Microsoft users worldwide report outages affecting banks, airlines READ: Renewables on pace to overtake coal as top power source by 2025
Soaring demand reflects ‚Äúthe growing role of electricity in our economies as well as the impacts of severe heatwaves,‚Äù said Keisuke Sadamori, the IEA‚Äôs director of energy markets and security.
Hydroelectric, solar, wind and other renewable sources are forecast to provide 35 percent of global supply next year, up from 30 percent in 2023, the agency said.
Solar alone is set to supply half the demand growth through 2025, with wind a further 25 percent.
Coal use is not expected to decline, however, as electricity use soars in China and India in particular, the IEA said.
Heatwaves across India are expected to lift electricity demand in the country by eight percent this year, while China‚Äôs demand is expected to grow six percent.
ADVERTISEMENT READ: Coal reliance growing in Philippines, Indonesia ‚Äî report
European demand is set to climb 1.7 percent. In the United States, where mild weather saw demand decrease last year, electricity use is set to rise three percent this year ‚Äî not least as the development of artificial intelligence spurs the creation of massive data centres.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs encouraging to see clean energy‚Äôs share of the electricity mix continuing to rise, but this needs to happen at a much faster rate to meet international energy and climate goals,‚Äù Sadamori said in a statement.
